para: Assigning a &material; to a &skel; &elemgroup; is a way of overriding the &material; assigned to pixels by . Normally an &elem;'s &material; is implicitly inherited from the &elem;'s dominant pixel. If a &material; has been explicitly assigned to an &elemgroup; with , the explicitly assigned &material; will be used instead of the implicitly inherited &material; for all &elems; in the group.

If an &elem; is in more than one &elemgroup;, the &elem;'s &material; is the last one assigned to any of the groups to which the &elem; belongs. If a &material; is assigned to a group that already had an explicitly assigned &material;, the new &material; replaces the old one for all &elems; in the group.
If an explicitly assigned &material; is removed with , the implicitly inherited &material; will be used.
In the GUI, is invoked by the Remove button in the Material subpane of the Element group operations pane in the Skeleton Selection Page when the page is in Elements mode.
